posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked: Hey everyone, I'm trying to figure out what type of connector this is. Here's the receiver.

posts.name: Nolan Barker
posts.cooked: This Plug N Play adapter connects universal lights, such as those showing chrome or other lighting, to the Pathfinder LED Lighting Distribution / Isolator Hub.

posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked: Yes, it goes to that hub but I can’t find what connector that is. It is not listed in any documentation.
This is a PATHFINDERLED connector. It appears to be a unique connector used solely by that brand.

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked: You’ve picked an intriguing idea. Using Google's search capabilities, I deduced that the item in question appears to be a non-standard connector featuring mirrored ridges on its bottom surface. However, it doesn’t seem to have symmetrically arranged pins from left to right unless the receiving end is tilted at an unusual angle. This suggests it wasn’t designed to be a universal or standard-fit connector. I concur with your assessment regarding Hermes8942.

posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked: The company is too small to use custom connectors.

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked: The connector has two ends, one for each gender. The female end is already visible on the diagram, but the male end isn't clear. If there's an image available showing both sides, that could be very helpful.

posts.name: Benjamin Rowe
posts.cooked: Also, the back of the male connector, where the wires slot in, they sometimes have maker marks on them for internal identification, like the APP on power poles.

posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked: I found it. Its a JST connector. Amazon.com: CNLW 5 Sets Automotive Connectors 04T-JWPF-VSLE-S and 04R-JWPF-VSLE-S 4 Pin Waterproof Connectors Male and Female Butt Plugs : Automotive
